title: Convert portfolio site into a South Essentials ecommerce storefront with themed default imagery

requirements.text:
Replace the current portfolio site branding and homepage structure with an ecommerce storefront for the brand "South Essentials", using the tagline exactly: "your one stop shop for south indian products".

Update all prominent user-facing branding (top navigation brand text, hero heading/wordmark text, primary CTA text) to reflect "South Essentials" and the tagline, and remove/replace portfolio-specific content ("Hariharan Ramani", writer-focused copy, services/about writer bio) so the site reads as a shop homepage.

quotes: Ok. Now make an ecommerce website for my brand, South Essentials. ... The tagline would be - your one stop shop for south indian products.

acceptanceCriteria: The hero section displays the brand name "South Essentials" and the tagline exactly as provided.
The top navigation no longer shows "Hariharan Ramani" or any writer/portfolio wording.
The page no longer presents writer portfolio sections (writer-focused About/Services copy) and instead presents storefront-style content sections appropriate for an ecommerce homepage.

requirements.text:
Implement a simple, static ecommerce browsing experience (no external payments) on a single-page React UI, including:
- A “Featured Categories” (or equivalent) section that highlights: South Indian temples, silk sarees, South Indian snacks, and traditional South Indian dance forms.
- A “Products” section that lists a small default set of products (static data stored in a frontend content/data file) with name, price, image, and category.
- A client-side cart (local state) allowing add/remove items and showing quantity and subtotal.
- A checkout action that is clearly labeled as a placeholder (e.g., “Checkout (Coming Soon)”) and does not integrate any payment provider.

Update navigation links to scroll to the new storefront sections.

quotes: Now make an ecommerce website for my brand, South Essentials.

acceptanceCriteria: Users can scroll via the top nav to the new ecommerce sections (categories, products, cart/checkout, and any remaining footer/contact if present).
At least one default product is shown for each requested category, backed by static frontend data.
Users can add products to a cart, adjust/remove them, and see subtotal updates without page refresh.
No third-party payment integration is present; checkout is explicitly a placeholder.

requirements.text: Generate and include default themed images representing: South Indian temples, silk sarees, South Indian snacks, and traditional South Indian dance forms. Store these images under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them as category and/or hero imagery in the storefront UI (no backend image routing).

quotes: Add default images of South Indian temples, silk sarees, south indian snacks and traditional dance forms of south.

acceptanceCriteria: All required new images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced via /assets/generated/... paths in the UI.
Each of the four requested themes is visually represented on the homepage.
No backend endpoints are used to serve or transform images.

requirements.text:
Update basic SEO and sharing metadata in frontend/index.html to match the new storefront branding:
- Title should include "South Essentials".
- Description should describe the storefront in English and include the tagline text.
- Update Open Graph and Twitter metadata to match the new title/description.

quotes: Now make an ecommerce website for my brand, South Essentials. ... The tagline would be - your one stop shop for south indian products.

acceptanceCriteria: The HTML <title>, meta description, og:title/og:description, and twitter:title/twitter:description reflect "South Essentials" and an English storefront description including the tagline.
No remaining SEO metadata references "Hariharan Ramani" or writer/portfolio positioning.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend logic only if required for the requested features.
Do not route generated images through the backend; serve from frontend/public/assets/generated.
nonGoals: Integrating real payments (Stripe/UPI/etc.) or building a real checkout flow.
Adding a database or external data storage; product/catalog can be static for this request.
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity (not required for this request).
Implementing real-time features (websockets, live inventory updates, chat).

required: South Indian temple exterior in warm daylight, wide banner composition (south-temple-hero.dim_1920x1080.png)
Silk saree textile close-up with rich colors and traditional patterns (silk-sarees-category.dim_1200x800.png)
Assorted South Indian snacks arranged on banana leaf / traditional plating (south-snacks-category.dim_1200x800.png)
Traditional South Indian dance form performance scene with expressive pose and costume (south-dance-category.dim_1200x800.png)
